channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish in road after collection, 4th July
item.description:
The recycling always leave behind recycling spilt from bags and crushed glass and plastic. Polystyrene pulled into Road with green bags and left.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Eleanor Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Many dogs illegally housed in council, 4th July
item.description:
Dogs continue to bark day and night council sys no pets. Barking coming from eitber cheadle court or castleford court nw8 8ud . Please investigate this matter as soon as possible. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Henderson Drive, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unpleasant smell from Waldo Recycling Centre, 4th July
item.description:
This has been an ongoing issue and previously it was flagged that the smell is due to food waste movement at the site and that de-odourising systems are constantly working, however the Waldo Recycling centre has not been operating since the beginning of 2025 year and we still have the unpleasant smell in the air in neighbouring streets. Can you please advise if anything is being done as part of the “once in generation infrastructure upgrade”? Is there any plan to plant more trees on neighbouring roads to improve air quality for residents?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Page Heath Villas, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees Choked Buddleia, 4th July
item.description:
Two trees on communal street space, planted by Hackney, currently choked by invasive buddleia, with some plant stems too thick to cut through manually. I could do more myself but I don't want to be accused of harming the trees themselves.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bakers Hill, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drains smell very bad, 4th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Newman Passage, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, City of Westminster

item.title: The recycling centre at Chislehurst High Street, 4th July
item.description:
• Please give brief details of your complaint or compliment below: Re the recycling centre at Chislehurst High Street. The plastic/can collection units have not been emptied for some time and are overflowing. As we live next to the centre we do not have a recycling bin collection so rely on the centre to dispose of our recycling. We have not been able to recycle our plastic/cans for at least 3 weeks. • What action (if any) would you like us to take? Empty the recycling collection units
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Adelaide Road, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Skipworth Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constructions materials dumped at on Nelson Mandela Road, 4th July
item.description:
Construction materials, including rubble, cement bags, tiles, and other debris, have been illegally dumped on Nelson Mandela Road. The materials are obstructing part of the pavement and pose a hazard to pedestrians and motorists. The dumping appears to be recent and is contributing to environmental degradation and potential safety risks. Immediate removal and investigation are requested.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nelson Mandela Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet
